website_summaries.verdict: Favorite model from a respected brand that's easy-to-assemble, solidly built and bargain priced. Single- and double-seat options offered.
pros: Ruggedly made, heavy-duty bike trailer rolls smoothly and is durable
Nicely vented trailer keeps kiddos cool while in motion
Smooth ride thanks to shock-absorbing suspension
cons: Unpadded harness straps are fiddly and uncomfortable
Legroom somewhat lacking for long-legged kids

customer_reviews.title: Good product and great customer service!
customer_reviews.text: We have two (now three) Allen trailers, the double child and the single trailer. The double trailer we were really happy with, but the cloth seat and drink pouches split at the seams after about 4 months/few hundred miles of use with just one child riding in it, so we contacted Allen customer service via their website. Really prompt reply from customer service and they replaced the double wagon after we emailed pics of the damage and receipt- thus the fourth star. Very impressed with their attentiveness and replacing whole unit.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Terrible harness
customer_reviews.text: The bike trailer is pretty good for the price. However, the 5 point harness is terrible. I mean, junk! I'm using this for a 2 and 4 year old. If I had a younger child that couldn't sit up very well yet or needed to be restrained better, this would have gone back immediately. The photos and description of the product are misleading. It shows a nice 5 point harness, not this cheap piece of garbage strap.
customer_reviews.author: Elaine

customer_reviews.title: Harness makes it a 1 star product.
customer_reviews.text: I took her out twice and both ocassions I had to stop several times to adjust her because she kept on sliding down and to the side. The trailer itself is great for the money but the haness system is not only below average but it different than the one on display in the pictures. I felt cheated and that is why I am giving it 1 star. You can see the picture on the left of the harness that came with my trailer and on the right a much better upgraded harness. Very dissappointed. For a moment I thought this was a steal.
customer_reviews.author: JPP

customer_reviews.title: Best Bang for Your Buck
customer_reviews.text: I love this and use it almost daily. I had sworn off of bike trailers for lugging my two kids around after buying an InStep a couple years ago. I was worried about sagging and ripped fabric as that was what did my other trailer in after just a few weeks. My kids are at the upper limit of the weight limit but this works great for them. There was no sagging in the foot area and it’s not terribly hard to tow, even with my beach cruiser bike. They are 1.5 and 4 but still fit decently together even though he’s really big for 1.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great great product and all under $100!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing they can produce this at such a low price. Such quality and well thought out. No issues with harness as someone else mentioned.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Definitely Recommend
customer_reviews.text: Got this in ASAP! Great starter trailer. Instructions included, but didn't even need any, so simple to assemble- I did it myself, didn't need any help. I have a 3 yr old granddaughter and 1 yr old grandson and they fit pretty good- feet room for 3yr old is pretty small for her leg length, but is good for th shorter rides we take. Not heavy at all to pull. Love the storage in the back. Great for our groceries and diaper bag. Even holds a gallon of milk, no prob. Will definitely recommend for other beginners who are like me and take the kids when they can to ride to the store and park.
customer_reviews.author: Christina Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: Safe for your siblings
customer_reviews.text: Very well Allen Sports. I was afraid on buying a trailer for my 1 year old daughter but, took the risk with this and I was really pleased. The quality and the metal frame really gives you peace of mind of having your baby on board of this. It could fit up to two children, it has compartments to place your wallet, water or anything else that you want to bring for cycling. What I like the most was how easy was to folded to either take it out for a run or store it. Wheels are easy to remove as well and best is that are an actual bicycle tire not a plastic one.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Rodriguez Molina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my 25lb dog
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my 25lb dog! You get what you pay for though, I don't think it would hold up two children's weight. Maybe 40 lbs max in my opinion. The bottom floor of the trailer is just a woven fabric so I would be afraid if I had a small child in there that it could break. But, it's perfect for my dog and supplies!
customer_reviews.author: Mary K

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer!
customer_reviews.text: My 5yo son was diagnosed with Leukemia last year. In the early stages he couldn't do much. He gained a lot of weight from steroids and was in pain from the leukemia and the chemo. He still wanted to go on bike rides though so we bought this. We ended up only going on 1 ride with it because he didn't feel like doing it. The trailer was easy to pull, seems to be pretty strong/durable, and seems to be big enough for two toddlers. I'd buy it again and recommend to friends!
customer_reviews.author: Mermalion

customer_reviews.title: Manufactured poorly!
customer_reviews.text: This gets 2 stars because after receiving it just days before we needed it for a vacation, super excited to put it together.... we pulled it from the box to find it impossible to put together. It was defected because when the gram was welded it wasn’t welded square. We couldn’t even put it together due to it being so badly manufactured. I gave it a second star only because luckily the Walmart in TN happen to have the exact same one and it had no issues. Returned this one for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Turner

customer_reviews.title: Nice carrier at a reasonable price.
customer_reviews.text: We are not hardcore bike riders so we did not want to spend a fortune on a carrier, but still wanted to take our children on rides occasionally. This was only $110 and I am glad we bought it! It is very durable and folds nicely for storage. It could be slightly bigger for the kids, but it does what we need it to do. I love that it has a screen or plastic cover to velcro over the kids in bad weather or cooler windy days. This is an excellent product.
customer_reviews.author: GoBlue

customer_reviews.title: RECOMMEND  for short/small kids
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE this bike trailer. I looked at tons on amazon and Walmart and finally decided on this one. I love the real tires. It’s not a 5 point harness but it held my 6 month old in pretty good! I added a blanket around her because my 2.5 year old was annoyed she kept leaning on her 🤣 Not sure how long this bike trailer will last due to legroom but I have tiny kids. Lol my 2.5 year old is 23lbs & 32in tall. It’s a small bike trailer FYI
customer_reviews.author: Chelsie

customer_reviews.title: Buyer beware!!
customer_reviews.text: Buyer beware!! If you have a bike that uses a quick release axle spindle the Trailer coupler will not fit on that spindle and still thread into the other side. It’s a huge pain in the ass and ended up with two trips to a bike store to find a longer spindle I got it working but wished I would’ve bought the 2step product instead. As I had one before and it was a much easier install.
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Stable to ride and heavy but not too heavy
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put together for anyone. Easy to ride and good quality (so it seems). Not tons of room to sit but still comfortable for two kids. The back is great to carry toys and diaper bag. We used it while camping to bike to the beach and it was just perfect. The kids giggled all the way to the beach and the little one fell asleep on the way back. So yes go ahead and get one. Sure you will love it
customer_reviews.author: roja ergun

customer_reviews.title: good for a dog, maybe not so great for a child
customer_reviews.text: We use this for a small dog - he is handicapped so can't walk far. We put a pillow under the "seat", to make a continuous, cushioned platform instead of the seat/footwell as designed. The stroller to trailer conversion is what we were after, it works pretty well although one with a front wheel that stays attached would be easier to use. The stroller handle attachment is a bit clunky but it gets the job done. Check the bolts for tightness - one fell off while in the car, fortunately we found it and re-attached. Overall I'd say good value for price but not the best design
customer_reviews.author: DIYer

customer_reviews.title: not an easy tow
customer_reviews.text: Well, I must say for the price, this is safe, enough room for 1 large toddler and his dog... and has nice viewing windows. But the wheels are small, the other more expensive one are a bit larger and have bigger tires. You wouldn't think the bigger tires would make a difference, but any ride longer than 5 miles with this in tow will double your effort as a rider. If you're taking your kids around the block, less than a mile or so.... sure.... but if you're riding 10+ miles on a dedicated bike trail... you will regret not just renting a nice one from the store on the side of the bike trail.
customer_reviews.author: MMG

customer_reviews.title: Great for Towing Toddlers
customer_reviews.text: After reading prior reviews, I was a little nervous to purchase this bike trailer. However, once I received it in the mail my concerns were quickly put aside. This trailer is PERFECT! My husband and I found it easy to assemble and we use it very regularly. The trunk space is easy to access and there is ample room for our backpacks and other toddler gear. We often use it to transport our toddler and groceries. We easily fit two toddlers in the space at one time. Would highly recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Vanessa Aguirre

customer_reviews.title: Great little trailer for the price
customer_reviews.text: This is a great trailer for the price. It's very compact. My 2 1/2-year-old had to bend her legs to sit in it and she's short. She seemed comfortable though. Very easy to pull with 2 kids and I don't even bike that often. I plan to get a second hitch so my husband can also pull it. Very easy to hook up. The only reason I didn't give 5 stars was because ours was missing one bolt.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi

customer_reviews.title: We love it, and on lookers do too!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble with instructions. Sleek looking. Feels sturdy. My 19 mo old enjoys our bike rides! I can appreciate the inside and outside pockets for added storage. I haven’t folded it yet since we’ve been riding everyday, however judging by assembly I don’t think it will be too difficult. We get a lot of compliments from people during our rides. The only con so far is that the flag came off on our first ride. We found it the next day during our ride, but it’s damages beyond repair. The flag is very flimsy.
customer_reviews.author: D. Smith

customer_reviews.title: A great trailer!
customer_reviews.text: What a great trailer. Don’t take sharp turns though! You could damage the integrity of your axel bolt and washer. Nice wide turns and you will be fine. My daughter is happy with it, the cup holder (2) is great for her water bottle. The trunk space is just right for baby’s bag. The rain plastic cover and mesh cover have individual velcro. I have a Columba 26 folding bike and the fitting is perfect on the axel. Overall we love it. I am timing myself on folding and setting up times, I’m down to 1 minute 45 seconds. So easy
customer_reviews.author: R. Henriquez

customer_reviews.title: What a score! Keep watching..not prime $75 and here in 2 days!!
customer_reviews.text: Just assembled in about 10 minutes and took the kids for a spin. This was effortless to pull and appreciate the orange flag for visibility. 6 y old rides solo on his bike in front as I pull our 2 year old. They love this and I appreciate us all being able to ride!No cheap plastic rims on this. Quality tires. Grabbed this new @$75..not prime and still arrived in 2 days. So so very happy!! Nice storage area in back to head out to the park and have room for lunch😊We even took the top down on this July day!
customer_reviews.author: D-leichtful

customer_reviews.title: Nice bike trailer for the price
customer_reviews.text: I’d recommend it, overall it’s a nice bike trailer for the price! It was fairly easy to assemble, just a couple pieces were difficult to click into place. It’s a little smaller than I expected, it’s a pretty snug ride for our almost 3yr old but not bad. The seat is more of a “sling” style, meaning it doesn’t have a hard bench which I actually prefer because I can’t imagine that would be comfortable for a toddler butt going over bumps in the road!
customer_reviews.author: Keely

customer_reviews.title: High Quality, High Recommendations
customer_reviews.text: Despite having a lower price than other trailers, I decided to buy this one based on the reviews and am definitely not disappointed. This is a high quality trailer, very solid, easy to assemble and break down, and fairly light weight. Considering all of the clips are tied to the trailer, I don't foresee losing any pieces. All of the fabric fits nice and tight. Plus, no tools needed for assembly. My kids also enjoy the ride. I highly recommend this trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Nick N.

customer_reviews.title: I don’t recommend!
customer_reviews.text: The product was not strong enough for two children. Not enough support in the bottom of the carrier. Children rolled into the middle and were on top of each other. I would not waste your money on this! It is unsafe. It has gotten a lot of good reviews, which is why we purchased it but I don't know what I would do if I were by myself on a trail and the tire blew. How would I carry my kids??? I'm very disappointed but I guess you get what you pay for!
customer_reviews.author: Eduardo f

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic value, great product
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Out of all the way too many things i've bought for my toddler, this is my favorite! Installed easily enough that i used to detach to bring just the bike inside. Sturdy, waterproof, solid wheels instead of those cheap plastic ones that instep uses. Been using it since just over a year old and my almost 2-year-old still gets SO excited when we go for rides. He also thought the flag was an amazing toy, and it has since been lost in toddlerland. Super solid AND super cheap, love it!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna

customer_reviews.title: I like this up to now.
customer_reviews.text: I looked at reviews on child trailers and decided to order this because this comes with 20 inch wheels. However, I was disappointed a lot when I received this because the box said that 16 inch wheels are with this. The reason why I bought this is 20 inch wheels. I was with Amazon assistant to get refund. While I was with her, I found a review which says this comes with 20 inch wheels instead of 16 inch ones (thank you, Chad M. Schmidt). I told her that I want to open the box and check the size of tire. It is 20 x 1.75!. I want to believe this comes with 20 inch wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Wonsuk Cha

customer_reviews.title: Love this!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I didn't want to break the bank because we weren't sure how often we would use this, but we are so happy with our purchase! Our 18 month old daughter frequently asks to go on the "bike". We do not have a second child yet, so she brings along her dolls or stuffed animals in the second seat right now. She has plenty of room and must be comfortable because she has fallen asleep multiple times on bike rides!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren D

customer_reviews.title: I would please like a contact info of this seller
customer_reviews.text: I usually don't write reviews in products I bought, but I'm very displeased with this product, I actually just bought this trailer, when arrived one of the wheel reflectors was broken, but since we were going on vacations we didn't care. My husband took my 40 lb son for a ride and came back dragging the carrier, because one of the wheels was actually bent, he tried to straight the axle with a hammer, and couldn't fix it since we were on our vacation and really wanted to take our kid for a ride. I would please like a contact info of this seller. Thank you.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Buy the double seat for one child.
customer_reviews.text: One, I do love this. I bought the double seated one for my 2 year old and she has enough room for herself alone. It wasn’t easy for me to assemble, but I’m not good at putting thing together. The instructions weren’t clear, but by husband got it done in 30 minutes. The metal piece that connects to the bicycle can fold down, I had a hard time pulling the lever out to fold it. But I do love this, is nice quality!
customer_reviews.author: Brianna Taylor

customer_reviews.title: and we still really like it. It's very well made
customer_reviews.text: We've owned this trailer for a few months now, and we still really like it. It's very well made, and my son loves to ride in it. The included flag, trunk space, and inside storage pockets have been useful features as well. It's a little tricky to figure out how to get the safety pin in/out when attaching it to the bike the first time (be careful), but feels secure and normally mounts in a few seconds. Compared to other trailers, I also like that this one has real tires with a metal rim/spokes.
customer_reviews.author: George

customer_reviews.title: Great Value!
customer_reviews.text: Put this together this weekend and was very impressed. It really comes pre-assembled. The "assembly" is what you would do every time you fold it down to transfer it. It just folds out and you insert a few quick connect pins. The whole process takes 2-3 minutes. My son loved riding in it and even had me pulling him around the house in it. The fabric seems durable. My only complaint is that I wish the side windows were mesh instead of plastic. I would be a bit worried bringing it out on a hot day because this limits the ventilation.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best purchase for a bike trailer!
customer_reviews.text: We bought this for our 1 year old. We decided to go with a 2 seater in case our niece was ever over and wanted to come with. Even with COVID 19, shipping was decent. It came with the easiest instructions and had it assembled in no time! It rides great with our bikes and easy to navigate with. My only complaint is that is is pretty small. Its a pro and a con. Folds up nicely and lightweight but not that much leg room. Great purchase though! very happy with it
customer_reviews.author: Blake L.

customer_reviews.title: Identical to a Burley Minnow
customer_reviews.text: Identical to a Burley Minnow for half the cost. Exactly what I was looking for - single seat, trunk, wet weather protection. The entire unit is very lightweight, structurally solid and well built. It folds flat nicely, and where the wheels can be contained inside. Although the wheels are a bit soft, inflating the tires to a high pressure should provide adequate longevity before needing to replace them.
customer_reviews.author: Sch0f

customer_reviews.title: Fun for the kids and for dad
customer_reviews.text: Perfectly as described! Great quality and puts me at ease knowing my kids are safe behind my husband’s bike as they ride. The wheels can withstand typical road and minor grass/rocks. We love to jump in this and ride to a park or a close by event when it’s nice. There’s also a pretty awesome flap for when it may surprise rain or sprinkle during your ride. Plenty of room for two toddlers and all their needs (diaper bag, snacks, drinks, towels, etc.) amazing quality time and fun for the price
customer_reviews.author: Kayle Growcock

customer_reviews.title: Strong and nice, but some details lack long term strength.
customer_reviews.text: Looks and pulls good. Very solid hookup, stout tires and frame. Good storage in rear. Back can be uncomfortable for anyone wearing a bike helmet, as the rear vertical fabric has no relief for helmets. Floor appears strong, but limited front legroom above age 3. Very disappointed in the top fabric, as it rubs on a frame screw on top and has started fraying and cutting after just 5 hours of ride time.
customer_reviews.author: Jet99

customer_reviews.title: Great for toddlers!
customer_reviews.text: Love it! Arrived just in time for our vacation. The assembly was straight forward and easy. I would say this product is great for smaller children. I bought this for my 3 year old who fits in it perfectly. She’s not uncomfortable or squeezed in but doesn’t have a ton of extra leg room either. I bought the single and prob should have bought the double for the purpose of added leg room. but she loves it and so do I. It’s very easy to bike with and does not make the bike feel heavier or shaky. I felt confident that she was safe and she loves going for bike rides in her “cave” lol
customer_reviews.author: fazwoman

customer_reviews.title: A great bike trailer for the money
customer_reviews.text: So far, so good! Ive been using this bike with my 1.5 year old for about a month now, and it has held up great. Easy to assemble, solid construction, trust worthy design, and the kiddo seems to like it. The storage bin below is not separated from the floor with the kids put their feet, FYI... and I feel like you can use it without the rain fly / air cover and be OK. Attaches pretty easily, takes less than 5 minutes to put on / take apart and fold down. Compact enough to store on the wall after collapsing.
customer_reviews.author: Chris F. Paterniti

customer_reviews.title: I'm rating this one a 4-star based on cost/function ratio.
customer_reviews.text: Love this trailer, especially for a fraction of the cost comparing to a brand name like Burley or Thule. It has everything you need, including the safety flag. It's built very solid with ample storage space in the rear. Bike connector is 360, I think that's what it's called, so that trailer remains upright even when bike is laid down. The only one criticism I have is its collapsability. You'll need to remove all the beefy safety pins which are quite hard to do by hand, and pretty much disassemble to collapse it. We have a van so I just stuff it in the back without collapsing it. Overall, very nicely and solidly built and you can't beat the cost.
customer_reviews.author: Cuong Le

customer_reviews.title: Stable, well-ventilated, and a great ride.
customer_reviews.text: Our son loves riding in his bike trailer! Assembly was not difficult. The trailer is stable and rides well. It is well ventilated. Also, the front can be rolled up and left completely open, have just the net down to help keep out insects, or with the plastic down to keep out rain. The only downside is there is not a ton of leg room, but our son doesn’t mind.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: nice but wish it was bigger
customer_reviews.text: it's a nice product but I just wish it was a little bit bigger I wanted to use it for my autistic son who is 10 and I couldn't. I was just company would make bigger sizes to accommodate those with special needs it would be really nice people would actually pay for it.
customer_reviews.author: P. Velez

customer_reviews.title: Great inexpensive option to tote the kids around
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this to cart around our 1.5 and 3 year old when we go riding. The trailer works well in that it is easy to hook up and ride with. Love that it has cup holders and plenty of extra storage. Simply enough to fold/unfold for storage & use - the quick release pins really help with this. Only downsides are that the kids are a bit cramped width-wise and the angle of the backrest makes it a bit awkward when the riders have helmets on - the steep angle and height of the back pushes their necks forward because there is no room for their helmets. All around though, it's worked out great. Good value for the money
customer_reviews.author: John Ellison

customer_reviews.title: Cool little trailer, wish it had a little bit more leg room though
customer_reviews.text: Great little trailer. Very smooth to pull. We had an instep one that the plastic wheels split on so this one with metal wheels was the way to go. I had to move the clasp on the safety cable as it was too short but that was an easy fix with a couple wrenches. Another thing I wish it had was the ability to move the 5 point harness to the middle as it is just one kid riding. It's a 4 yr old riding and he's a little tight but he still likes it. This should do him until he grows out enough to go faster on his own bike.
customer_reviews.author: SarahJo Griggs

customer_reviews.title: It pulls nice but is on the small side for being a ...
customer_reviews.text: It pulls nice but is on the small side for being a two kid trailer. Two kids over three is going to be a tight fit.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Henry

customer_reviews.title: It's ok
customer_reviews.text: To use as a stroller is just awkward. The front tire is fixed so it's not as comfortable to use as a stroller and try and turn. It takes 10-15 minutes for us to hook it up to the bike so it's not quick and easy either. Everything about it worked fine while we used it on our bike ride. There's enough room for our 15 month to sit inside comfortably and enough coverage from sun and wind. I wish it had a little more seat padding (he sat on a blanket) and shock absorption (speed bumps looked painful for him).
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Gohlich

customer_reviews.title: One flat tire
customer_reviews.text: The product seems great but when I was unboxing one tire was flat. I put it together and hocked it up to my bicycle filled the tire with air and road 4 blocks with my kids and the tire went flat. Had to walk the rest of the way home. I live in a small town and the closest town that has a Walmart is over an hour away. My small town does not carry anything bicycle related tire tubes Etc. What a waste of a weekend when I showed my kids that we would be able to ride as a family.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Small

customer_reviews.title: Not as great as everyone is saying
customer_reviews.text: I'm not too sure why bike bloggers are rating this high. Both my 4 year old and 18 month old look like they're dangling in the harness rather than sitting in the seat. The older one eventually complained his crotch hurt. It makes me very nervous having them sit in it. Their helmets get pushed forward as well. Don't rely on the instructions. I had to use logic to figure out how it is put together.
customer_reviews.author: MamaMimi

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to pull, sturdy, and convenient to use. Very nice, my daughter loves riding in it. The only drawback is that if it's used for two children they have to be very small, probably under 30 lbs each. My 2 1/2 year old daughter is 37 lbs and fits comfortably in there by herself. There isn't much legroom, she has to pull her legs up to fit in.
customer_reviews.author: Drewbie

customer_reviews.title: East setup! Value!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is AWESOME! I was hesitant to stray from the known brands, but this product had everything I was looking for (and more) for the price I wanted. I have dragged this buggy all over! It folds, it holds, it's light. You can never lose the pins because they are secured to the buggy! It's a dream to put together!
customer_reviews.author: Mrs Jones

customer_reviews.title: Works great...just what I was looking for!!
customer_reviews.text: Item was delivered as advertised. It was very easy to put together. It has a spring swivel joint close to where you connect it to the bike. I intentionally knocked the bike over after I attached it, and the trailer didn't budge. From the time I started opening the box to the time I connected it to the bike took about 15 minutes. I haven't had a chance to put my grand baby in it yet...will update after further use.
customer_reviews.author: Michael H.

customer_reviews.title: Great product!
customer_reviews.text: First off- easy to assemble, weather proof, and rides great! Our son is a little small for his age and we have noticed that the straps are a bit too high and tend to rub on his neck and shoulders- I recommend putting on some carseat shoulder straps-done us some wonders! We also like to put a little extra cushioning (blankets) on the sides when he sits in the middle. My husband was talking about altering it a little by adding some sort of suspension so it’s not so rough on the bumps! I would highly recommend this bike trailer to anyone looking for an affordable option!
customer_reviews.author: Natasha

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for my two boys! They LOVE it!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this on sale for $70 (new ones go for $130) and it's definitely worth the price! It was easy to asemble, breaks down to flat with tires removed, and it VERY useful with two boys under age 3. They love having daddy take them for bicycle rides! I like the easily detachable "hitch" that connects to my back wheel. My only annoyance is that the spring that allows more flexibility when turning tends to squeak over even the smallest bumps. However, the rest of it is soo amazing that it didn't deserve to lose a star.
customer_reviews.author: NittnyLion04

customer_reviews.title: Lousy Customer Service
customer_reviews.text: Cool trailer but on first use one of the tires came loose from the rim. Pushing it back into place worked for two minutes before it fell off the rim again and boom flat tire. Figured I could easily call Allen customer service and get a replacement wheel assembly, no big deal stuff happens. Called Allen customer service twice, no answer. Entered a claim online. No answer. Called again and spoke with sales since I figured they'd answer. They sent in a claim and I received an email response with, "thank you for your message. Unfortunately, we do not have any wheels available as replacements." No solution offered, nothing. Will be returning to Amazon and not purchasing from Allen.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: My son loves this item!
customer_reviews.text: The first one that delivered to us had an issue; the metal frame was broken. We asked for a replacement and received a brand new one within a week and half or so. We love it! It is durable, easy to assemble and disassemble and provides a very sturdy and comfortable ride for my 6 month old son. We haven't used it as a trailer yet, but as a stroller we absolutely love it. I will update my review once we hooked it up to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: Calvin D. Giles III

customer_reviews.title: Impressed!
customer_reviews.text: We have only used this for a month, but it was an easy assembly and hook up to bike, and has been great with toddlers. I will update should anything change, but so far, this is a quality product!
customer_reviews.author: BVLA

customer_reviews.title: We're diggin' it!
customer_reviews.text: It's been crazy trying to find one during the pandemic, but if you can catch this one while its available I'd recommend! It came weeks before it was estimated to, which was amazing! Husband had to trouble putting it together and hooked on with ease, haven't tried the "stroller" part yet. Our 3 1/2 and 1 1/2 year old girls fit great together in it. The 8 year old even likes to climb in alone and ride around the yard. It rides nicely and isn't hard to handle. Comes with less air in tires for shipping purposes just make sure to fill them before taking off!
customer_reviews.author: Kaitie C.

customer_reviews.title: Stays upright.
customer_reviews.text: My bike tipped over and the (unoccupied) trailer stayed upright. Seems like a good safety feature. The thing I dislike is that the back pocket does not have a bottom. When I put my sunblock back there, it slides down, under my toddlers feet. Now she can reach it. Not good.
customer_reviews.author: Minnesota Mama

customer_reviews.title: Amazing all around!
customer_reviews.text: Always a nice start when shipping is prompt. The assembly process was extreamly simple and quick, I really like the fact that it can be broken down in under a minute and put back in it's box. Awesome design. The ride is very level and stance of the cart is pretty square. All in all this is a great product. However I wish they put more reflective material on it and some external pouches.
customer_reviews.author: Erick/Karen

customer_reviews.title: Best for kids under 5
customer_reviews.text: With the weight limit we thought it would be good for our 3 and 5 year old, but they are very cramped in there for shoulder space, butt space, and leg room. It fits the 3 year old and a small cooler much better. We haven’t tried to fold it up at all. Seat belts are secure and the flap to open/close is easy to use. Smooth ride.
customer_reviews.author: Tony M.

customer_reviews.title: Great deal for a bike trailer and stroller in one.
customer_reviews.text: This bike trailer/stroller is fantastic! So easy to switch between biking and stroller. My son is really big for his age and very tall. He like to spread out so I bought the two person one for him. It’s effortless to push and very easy to tow. He climbs in it whenever he wants to go for a ride. The only annoying thing is I wish there was a window in the top so when your pushing your child you can see what they are doing. I have not folded it down to transport it yet.
customer_reviews.author: Patricia Colton

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: So far we’ve had this all summer and my Kids love it. They sometimes even fall asleep while going for a ride. My kids are 3 and 1 and they fit perfectly in there together, compared to the more expensive ones this is a steal and does the job so well. Super easy to assemble on and off the bike and rides very smoothly
customer_reviews.author: Polly

customer_reviews.title: My 2 year loves it!
customer_reviews.text: Great quality. Very easy assembly. Remember to put the screen down. My 2 year was crying bc “bugs were getting her”.... I wasn’t getting bit at all.... I realized it was the tiny rocks flying off my back tire hitting her :( oops. Bad dad moment.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Juha

customer_reviews.title: Great bike trailer at a great price!
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic little trailer! It folds up easily, seems very durable, and has ample amount of room. The leg room is interesting, because it has a fair amount of it, but if you have little ones then they sometimes will like to kick out the Velcro screen protector, would have preferred this to have been a full zipper setup, but the Velcro isn’t bad.
customer_reviews.author: Nate Jusko

customer_reviews.title: Top cover torn apart easily
customer_reviews.text: Not sure how much wind it can take but putting the trailer on the SUV roof for couple of mile trip made top canopy shred into unusable junk, just due to wind!. I made sure it is tucked and not flapping in the wind like a flag. I bet it was not tested in wind tunnel for practical endurance. Outdoor enthusiast with kids, this may be one time use for you.
customer_reviews.author: SSeiichii

customer_reviews.title: NOT A STROLLER
customer_reviews.text: This product is falsely advertised. This is not user friendly as a stroller, it's primary use is to be towed by a bike. Everything about this product is complicated from the assembly to the folding, which basically requires a disassemble and a reassemble every time. Also, the front wheel does not turn making it very difficult to use as a stroller. Very disappointing, do not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Maui

customer_reviews.title: Sewn incorrectly
customer_reviews.text: Had the it for two months. The fabric is was not sewn correctly and is coming apart. poorly sewn. Very disappointed with the workmanship of the material. I called the Allen Company twice with all my information and still no response. Very poor Customer Service! Can anyone help me?
customer_reviews.author: Priates Aunt

customer_reviews.title: Everything we wanted
customer_reviews.text: This thing is awesome! Our 1.5 year old loves hanging out in it while we ride. It is plenty light enough and rolls super easy. The first time we went out on it, I kept looking behind me to make sure it was still hooked up! The colors are good, the straps keep him in and the material seems like it will last a while.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Schreiber

customer_reviews.title: Its sturdy and holds up to my kids playing in it ...
customer_reviews.text: People always ask me where I got this attachment from and seem shocked that I got it online. Its sturdy and holds up to my kids playing in it as well as us going out for a ride, as well as it being used to transport light groceries. I am seeing signs of me putting the weight limits to the test but I'm not worried about my children falling out of the bottom Flintstone style or anything like that.
customer_reviews.author: M. Sanderson

customer_reviews.title: Well built and awesome price...hard to pass up for a single seat buy.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent well built trailer. This was easy to assemble, attaching to a bike was simple, and my kids love it. The "trolley" as my daughter calls it, is very safe and solidly built. The tires are great and need only be inflated to the placard pressure. The Velcro is strong for the most part and the windscreen/rain covers are very helpful. The harness inside is very secure but not very easy to adjust for different sized children.
customer_reviews.author: B1uefox

customer_reviews.title: Good, well-built, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: This thing is really easy to set up - I pulled it out of the box and was able to have it assembled in the matter of 5 minutes. It also folds easily for storing or hauling around in your car. It seems to be well-built; the frame is all steel, so it's kind of heavy, but not terribly so. Also, it doesn't drag your bike back, so the bearings on the wheels are pretty decent as well. We were concerned about the poor wheel reviews on other trailers, and how the warping would cause the tires to pop. But this one has steel spokes and hubs, and we haven't had an ounce of trouble with it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer!
customer_reviews.text: I get lots of use out of this trailer. My son and I go on a bike route that passes multiple parks with childrens play areas. He is always eager to climb into the bike trailer and the tour of the parks is good cardio for me and it wears him out before his nap time. The 5 point harness inside is a good safety feature. The metal rims and the type of tires that it uses was the deciding factor for me. It could use more headroom in the design as my son is only a year and a half old and with his helmet on he has little room to grow without bending forward as he rides.
customer_reviews.author: Honest Feedback

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: Could use a bit more padding in the seating area, but overall serves its purpose very well. Its very maneuverable and offers (2) barrier screens, (1) mesh and (1) full plastic. Mesh screen offers ventilation and the plastic overlapped screen offers protection from rain. Comes with an adapter to easily connect the trailer to the bike.
customer_reviews.author: The dude

customer_reviews.title: Disability and works for me
customer_reviews.text: Due to my disability i can’t cycle. I’m 4’4 78 pounds. My bf hooked it up to his bike so easy and I was able to see San Diego ! I can sit on my legs no issues so i fit perfectly and the ride was so smooth
customer_reviews.author: Misty

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great trailer! I only use it for my son so I'm not sure how well two children would fit. He can sit in the middle with the seat belt arrangement and is very secure during our rides. Spoked wheels and a canvas seat that can move somewhat make for a pretty comfy ride. No issues setting this up and storage is quick and easy. The trailer also appears very safe and will not fall over even if you drop your bike (no idea about falling at speed).
customer_reviews.author: Rianna

customer_reviews.title: Great Carrier-Fits 29ers
customer_reviews.text: This really is an amazing carrier. Fits great through axel of back wheel on my Trek Marlin 29er (29" tires). Will fit any bikes trough back axel from 29" and below. I have the quick release on back tire which is great. Already put in dozens of miles with my 2 year old and good way to stay in shape.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Bike Trailer
customer_reviews.text: This is a well made bike trailer for kids. - Room for 2 kids - Pretty Sturdy - Easy to assemble and disassemble - You need to add some padding below the seat with a jacket or something otherwise it sinks too much. - I would really recommend getting this.
customer_reviews.author: mmbmca

customer_reviews.title: Great value for the price
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the price. easy to fold up to fit in the car. Easy to switch between the jogger and the bike trailer. Ride to the park or zoo. unhook add the front tire and you have your jogger to enjoy the rest of your visit. This has been as easy and stable as our regular jogger. do to the duel purpose we use this one more.
customer_reviews.author: F&J McD

customer_reviews.title: 2 & 5 yr olds love riding in it.
customer_reviews.text: 2 yr old & 5 yr old love it! If your hefty you should start to exercise. The fat life isn't enjoyable even if you continually lie to yourself. Get off your behinds you lazy, hefty, piece of pop. Helpful... yes sir!
customer_reviews.author: Benjamin

customer_reviews.title: Best for the price!
customer_reviews.text: This is great! My 3yr old and 12m old fit good in here, they love riding in it. It was easy to assemble and attach to bike. The seat belts could be more comfortable but otherwise this is great! You can't beat the price and it has real wheels not plastic ones.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Safe and sturdy!!! Great product! ❤️
customer_reviews.text: Pretty darn impressed. It is a lot smaller than I expected, so if your “two” children are the size of midwestern cattle farmers, your two kids won’t fit. Otherwise, great material! Sturdy! The actual instructions are pretty vague but it’s EXTREMELY easy to figure out. Very happy overall.... (go with the 2 seater if you only have 1 kid)
customer_reviews.author: Angie A.

customer_reviews.title: Doesnt til over when bike is laid down
customer_reviews.text: Great product and it's nice that when the bike is laid down, it doenst fall over. Which I did not know some do that. Great Quality just make sure you keep the shield zipped because dirt slings up from the bike
customer_reviews.author: Michelle Hout

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight and easy
customer_reviews.text: Instructions arent great but it's still super easy and intuitive to assemble. No tools required! Its lightweight and easy to pull, I have quick release tires and had no problem attaching it. Its great
customer_reviews.author: Keerla

customer_reviews.title: Our daughter loves her trailer!!!
customer_reviews.text: My husband, daughter and I absolutely love this trailer/stroller. We use it mostly as a jogging stroller and it's been a great help. Our daughter loves that there are pockets inside for her to put snacks and toys in. While my husband and I are running she has a lot of fun with her toys that fit in the space inside the trailer. The one thing we dislike about this trailer is that no matter how much the tires are pumped that stroller tends to go left.
customer_reviews.author: Gena Lembke

customer_reviews.title: Best bang for the buck
customer_reviews.text: This bike trailer is the best one out there for good quality without breaking the bank. The only thing I would say is that the leg room is dependent on how big your kids are. It will be kind of a tight fit if you have toddlers. Mine are 2 and 4. The 2 year old has plenty of legroom. The 4 year old is a little cramped but can still ride comfortably. I would say that if you only have one kid, this would still be an ideal choice.
customer_reviews.author: AIRIKA

customer_reviews.title: The attachment does not fit my new Cruiser bike!
customer_reviews.text: This trailer don’t fit on my brand new cruiser bike! It fit my older cruiser bike but not my new one. I’ve already used it, so I can’t return it! So now I need to find a different attachment if there is one. The trailer is nice and spacious. The harness seems uncomfortable/cheap. My daughter is 13 month olds old and I had to put my own shoulder pads on it from her stroller. She fell asleep while riding and it does not recline so her head was forward and she seemed uncomfortable especially because she was wearing a helmet. It seems to be more suitable for an older child.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I expected
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my toddler who is 3. I decided to get the double passenger size so he would have more room. He loves going for rides with me. There isn’t much leg room but it works out when he rides alone.
customer_reviews.author: Beaner

customer_reviews.title: It comes with bike connector
customer_reviews.text: This thing is sturdy and has a smooth ride. It has a bike adapter that comes with it and it worked perfectly. The only reason i did not give it 5 stars is bc the restraints are flimsy and was easy for my 2 yr old to slip out.
customer_reviews.author: douglas

customer_reviews.title: Wrong wheel size
customer_reviews.text: Was shipped the yellow and it did not come with 20” wheels like it states in its description which was the only reason I purchased this trailer. Dont buy this unless you only want 16” wheels.
customer_reviews.author: Gloria

customer_reviews.title: It's OK and works well instructions are usless
customer_reviews.text: Everything about this carrier is fine with the exception of the installation manual it was ridiculous. It is easy to put together but the instructions were useless. The carrier itself is nice
customer_reviews.author: holtySenior

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: Good product. Comparable with radcity bikes as well. The only thing I didn't like was that although it has a 100 lb weight limit, my 5 years old, who is 45 lbs and short for her age was a tight squeeze as far as head space and fitting in w my 1.5 yr old.
customer_reviews.author: Amy F

customer_reviews.title: Very nice!
customer_reviews.text: Easy to assemble! Looks great!! We connected to a beach cruiser after trying to connect a bike seat first. My toddler loves riding in it. Wish I would have purchased this first!
customer_reviews.author: Ashlee Slifco

customer_reviews.title: Great price, easy to assemble
customer_reviews.text: Great price, easy to assemble, and works great. We put both our 1 year old and 3 year old in it and they love it. Would buy again, very happy with it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Stevenson

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful bike trailer
customer_reviews.text: We love this! We use it 4-5 nights a week with our two year old and it's like he has his own chariot. It seems well-made (we haven't had any issues and we've had it for two months), smooth riding for our son and fairly easy to transfer between my bike or my husband's bike. Has two pockets inside to hold his drink. I wish it had a pocket in the back to hold a few other things and keep out of his reach but other than that it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: M L Bourns

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have 2.5 year old twins who love coming along for a bike ride with me now! They are about 36” and are already getting to the point of needing to keep their knees bent to fit in length wise. They fit perfectly next to each other though. Hoping to get at least a few years out of it. We’ll see!
customer_reviews.author: Jackie A.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase!
customer_reviews.text: I wasn't sure how well this would turn out considering it was fairly cheap (not complaining!) but it works great, and my 17 month old loves it! She has plenty of room in there and it rides smoothly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent bike trailer
customer_reviews.text: Unfortunately it doesn't fit on our Trek bikes so we have to use it on our old mountain bike. Works well so far for our little one (18 months), we'll have to see how it holds up once he's bigger.
customer_reviews.author: RMC80

customer_reviews.title: Great trailer for the price. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to assemble and easy to get on and off the bike. Owned a couple different trailers and this one is a great value for the price. Fits our two kids (2 and 4 year old) well. I'd definitely recommend it to someone looking for a reasonably priced trailer.
customer_reviews.author: Just trying to help 😁

customer_reviews.title: New cart is replacing the one someone stole along with my bicycle
customer_reviews.text: I love it I can have my dog inside and pack y tent and all my camping gear and just take off. Always take it to the store when I shop. Hate getting on the bus with bags. It plays a very big part in my daily activities. Pulls easy and very good looking.
customer_reviews.author: Susan  Tomes

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, easy to assemble, good size
customer_reviews.text: Can't beat this for the money. Until someone comes up with a method that doesn't involve removing the nut from you back wheel, this is the way to go. Sturdy, easy to assemble, have used it to take our Morkie for a ride and transported our cooler as well.
customer_reviews.author: TheTruth13

customer_reviews.title: So much fun!!
customer_reviews.text: Very easy set up. For the most part its a couple of quick attach folks, and wheels with cotter pins. My 2.2 yearold fits great, however I could see how 2 kids would get squished in there. I would really like to see customizable seats. So if we need to take just the one kid we can move the safety harnesses to the middle so she's not leaning on the side.
customer_reviews.author: Woods, M

customer_reviews.title: Great for a cruiser!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Easy to assemble and works great with my cruiser style bike. I ride a Public C7, similar to a Townie or any other 7 speed cruiser. This trailer is great for the bike, easy to pull, big tires, and relatively light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Kelly

product_meta.title: Allen Sports Deluxe Steel Child Trailer
feature_bullets: Lightweight steel construction trailer with durable quick release 16 inch steel wheels
Safely and comfortably transports 2 children (up to 100 pounds max payload)
Large front and side windows provide a bright, airy cabin for your little rider
Foot guard tube protect passenger's feet, and a padded 5 point safety harness comfortable holds your child in place
Folding design with quick release wheels makes for easy transport and storage
Allen's warranty does not cover items purchased through third-party sellers

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
